psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 119,1]]Blessed are they whose way is blameless, 
who walk in the law of the LORD.

[[Ps 119,27]]Make me understand the way of your precepts, 
and I will meditate on your wondrous deeds.

[[Ps 119,30]]The way of truth I have chosen;
I have set your ordinances before me.

[[Ps 119,34]]Give me discernment, that I may observe your law 
and keep it with all my heart.

[[Ps 119,35]]Lead me in the path of your commands, 
for in it I delight.

[[Ps 119,44]]I will keep your law continually, 
forever and ever.

first_reading.text:
[[Pr 21,1]]Like a stream is the king's heart in the hand of the LORD; wherever it pleases him, he directs it.
[[Pr 21,2]]All the ways of a man may be right in his own eyes, but it is the LORD who proves hearts.
[[Pr 21,3]]To do what is right and just is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
[[Pr 21,4]]Haughty eyes and a proud heart-- the tillage of the wicked is sin.
[[Pr 21,5]]The plans of the diligent are sure of profit, but all rash haste leads certainly to poverty.
[[Pr 21,6]]He who makes a fortune by a lying tongue is chasing a bubble over deadly snares.
[[Pr 21,10]]The soul of the wicked man desires evil; his neighbor finds no pity in his eyes.
[[Pr 21,11]]When the arrogant man is punished, the simple are the wiser; when the wise man is instructed, he gains knowledge.
[[Pr 21,12]]The just man appraises the house of the wicked: there is one who brings down the wicked to ruin.
[[Pr 21,13]]He who shuts his ear to the cry of the poor will himself also call and not be heard.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 8,19]]The mother of Jesus and his brothers came to him but were unable to join him because of the crowd.
[[Lc 8,20]]He was told, "Your mother and your brothers are standing outside and they wish to see you."
[[Lc 8,21]]He said to them in reply, "My mother and my brothers are those who hear the word of God and act on it."
